Package net.xqhs.flash.core

Class Loader.SimpleLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.flash.core.Loader.SimpleLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Loader<Entity<?>>
    Enclosing interface:
    Loader<T extends Entity<?>>
    public static class Loader.SimpleLoader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Loader<Entity<?>>
    Simple implementation for Loader, which attempts to load the entity class by instantiating it:
    • using a constructor that receives a MultiTreeMap as argument, or
    • using the default constructor, and if the instance implements ConfigurableEntity, subsequently calling ConfigurableEntity.configure(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap).

    The class is loaded using the classpath provided as the first value in the simple key of the given entity configuration. If no such classpath exists, loading fails.

    Author:
    andreiolaru

      • load

        public Entity<?> load​(MultiTreeMap configuration,
                      java.util.List<Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>>> context,
                      java.util.List<MultiTreeMap> subordinateEntities)
        The method will attempt to instantiate a new entity, using the classpath from the "classpath" parameter in the configuration (as a simple key).

        The instantiation is tried in order:

        • using a constructor that receives a MultiTreeMap as argument, passing the given configuration;
        • using the default constructor, and if the instance implements ConfigurableEntity, the ConfigurableEntity.configure(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap) method will be called with the given configuration.

        After loading, all entities in the context parameter are added as context, using Entity.addGeneralContext(EntityProxy).

        No subordinate entities will be loaded.

        Specified by:
        load in interface Loader<Entity<?>>
        Parameters:
        subordinateEntities - - this will not be used.
        configuration - - the configuration data for the entity.
        context - - the entities that form the context of the loaded entity. The argument may be null or empty.
        Returns:
        the entity, if loading has been successful.

      • load

        public Entity<?> load​(MultiTreeMap configuration)
        Description copied from interface: Loader
        Loads a new instance of entity T, without providing it with any context.

        See also Loader.load(MultiTreeMap, List, List).

        Specified by:
        load in interface Loader<Entity<?>>
        Parameters:

        Returns:
